Topic.Title: Any updates on Icera modems shipping?

Message.Msg: . Sounds like a scratch, boys. "Qualcomm superb radios are usually not compatible with NVIDIA SoC chips." "Qualcomm made sure that such incompatibility exists to screw NVIDIA." . Engineers absolutely Love Qualcomm parts. Qualcomm -- THE Undisputed King of All Things Wireless. Heck, Qualcomm derives income -- directly or indirectly -- from each and every wireless device on the planet. So if engineers demand Qualcomm radio parts -- they'll just have to buy their commodity ARM processor chips Elsewhere. Did I mention? It's a scratch, boys. .

Topic.Title: Now I'm gonna make the NVIDIOTS extremely jealous

Message.Msg: My long position isn't doing all that bad. Nvidia is a roller coaster. Making "realized" gains on the big ups and sitting on "unrealized" breakeven/small losses on the downs. Overall I've been making money. The way I see it. I'd like lower prices. More money to be made on a company this strong. Big cash position, major new products are coming, and there is also one other little thing..."THEY ARE SELLING EVERYTHING THEY MAKE." Its only a matter of time now till the stock reflects the companies performance.

Message.Title: Android devices have already been found to infringe 17 valid patents
Message.Msg: . Android is losing in Court, boys. And losing Badly. Google and weep: Android devices have already been found to infringe 17 valid Apple and Microsoft patents Foss . "Only a minority of all patent assertions brought against Android-based devices have been adjudicated so far. The number of patents held to be infringed will keep growing, and I'll probably have to update this list a couple of times before the end of the year." .

They always do. ~S

Topic.Title: Can Apple apps store maintain its lead over Google Play? (El Goog is only 25000 apps away)

Message.Msg: Of course it will, particularly in paid apps. Android users have a cheapskate rep and want all their apps for free. Developers know they can make the most money developing Apple versions first, or exclusively.

Topic.Title: Android devices have already been found to infringe 17 valid patents

Message.Msg: . Apple's world-class iLitigators continue to Crush the Android ecosystem. Google this and take a look: Apple continues to sue three leading Android device makers (Samsung, Motorola Mobility, and HTC), In excerpts. Apple continues to sue three leading Android device makers (Samsung, Motorola Mobility, and HTC), and Microsoft continues to sign up licensees who take their destiny into their own hands as they realize a need to address Android's massive, court-validated patent infringement issues. In May, Nokia commenced a patent assertion campaign against Android device makers (as well as BlackBerry maker Research In Motion). Other large publicly-traded companies claiming that Android infringes their intellectual property include Oracle, British Telecom (BT), Fujifilm, and eBay. . The whole patent infringing Android ecosystem is under Thermonuclear attack, boys. Hey! Maybe that's why Mike Rayfield abandoned nvidia and joined Micron? .

Topic.Title: GOING RED! HOW COULD THIS BE???

Message.Msg: @Roydirect Thank you for the response. (sorry I don't see another way to post at a reply) Technicals make sense. I can see those looking lousy. I can see this selling off at the moment with fear of europe and large funds making bets around them. After all they don't want to be stuck in something volatile without a dividend when the stock market tanks. -But its this time of year when tech gets seasonal and sells better than normal for the holiday season. -Project Denver could be announced more officially any quarter now. Maybe even a working prototype as well. Even a little market share take away from Intel and amd would be big early on. -Nvidia is in all of the major tech growth businesses. Such as cloud and mobile. Texas Instruments even basically conceded mobile to Nvidia and Qualcom. -Nvidia is supply constrained but as yields improve, their profits do as well. -Nvidia has tons of cash/cash equivalents. They will weather just about any storm. So ya I can see the big guys bailing (making technicals look bad) but I have too many reasons to be positive on this company. Unfortunately they do have the selling power to drag the stock price down.
